title: Tokyo Olympics: How to think like a champion
description: Newsbeat speaks to Bill Beswick, the psychologist behind the 26-year-old breaststroke star.

title: H.E.R. on shedding her anonymity and conquering R&B
description: For years the singer stayed in the shadows but after Grammy and Oscar wins she's ready to be seen.

title: My Money: 'I had forgotten how it all adds up'
description: Marketeer Toni says being able to socialise more and meet colleagues is pushing her spending higher.

title: Gaza photographer hopes digital art boom can help raise aid money
description: A Palestinian photographer wants to help children by selling an image from May's conflict.

title: South Africa riots: The inside story of Durban's week of anarchy
description: The worst unrest since white-minority rule ended has left deep scars, especially in the coastal city of Durban.

title: Music industry turns to livestreaming to boost revenue
description: Festivals, DJs and musicians are all using new tech to entertain fans and make money during Covid.

title: Covid vaccines: Tourists head to the US to get vaccinated
description: Some tourists are spending thousands of dollars to travel to the US to get a coronavirus vaccine.

title: Mikey Poulli: The young blind footballer backed by star players
description: Mikey Poulli, who lost his sight due to a rare degenerative condition, dreams of playing for England.

title: 'We lost our life savings in a cryptocurrency scam'
description: A pensioner caught up in an investment saga lost it all, prompting warnings to others.

title: Why cannabis is still a banned Olympics substance
description: US sprinter Sha'carri Richardson won't compete due to a positive marijuana test. People are asking why.

title: Arthur: Popular children's show to end after 25 years
description: US public broadcaster PBS confirmed the final episode will air in winter 2022.

title: Midtjylland dump Celtic out of Champions League
description: Beleaguered Celtic's Champions League hopes ended in the second qualifying round for the second consecutive year as a callow side were undone in extra time by Denmark's Midtjylland.

title: Marble Arch Mound: 'I wouldn't pay £4 to walk up a hill'
description: The public reacts to London's newest tourist attraction, which is facing complaints of being incomplete.

title: Are middle-aged people more unhealthy than ever?
description: Why could the current cohort of 40-somethings be proving less healthy than previous generations?

title: Covid: Medal for GP who came out of retirement to treat patients
description: A GP who came out of retirement to treat patients in the pandemic is awarded a medal.

title: What are the twisties in gymnastics?
description: US gymnast Simone Biles said she was "having a little bit of the twisties".

title: Aerial dancers enjoy striking Honister sunrise performance
description: Three aerial dancers suspend themselves from 1,000ft (305m) up for a routine in the Lake District.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Charlotte Dujardin wins dressage bronze to become most decorated female Briton
description: Great Britain's Charlotte Dujardin becomes Great Britain's most decorated female Olympian by winning dressage bronze at Tokyo 2020.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain sevens plans 'a joke' - Dan Bibby
description: Great Britain sevens star Dan Bibby describes a planned future sevens programme as "a joke" after the team miss out on a medal in Tokyo.

title: Let more Afghan interpreters resettle in UK, say ex-military chiefs
description: More Afghans who worked for British forces should be allowed to resettle in the UK, former military chiefs say.

title: Covid travel: No quarantine for fully jabbed from EU and US coming to UK
description: The travel industry had been pushing for the rule change so tourists can more easily come to England.

title: Wales' slate landscape wins World Heritage status
description: The north-west slate mining area is said to have "roofed the world" at its height in the 19th Century.

title: Covid: Deaf woman wins claim over lack of sign language at briefings
description: A lack of sign language at government briefings amounts to discrimination, a High Court judge finds.

title: Covid: Self-isolation rule changes on 16 August 'nailed on' - PM
description: Recent falls in cases are encouraging but it is too early to draw conclusions, Boris Johnson says.

title: Richarlison sends defending champions Brazil into quarters as Germany tumble out
description: Brazil ease through to the quarter-finals of the men's Olympic football but 2016 silver medallists Germany are eliminated.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Why 'superhuman' Simone Biles could change attitudes to mental health in sport
description: Athletes discuss Simone Biles' decision to prioritise her mental health at the Tokyo Olympics and how she could change attitudes in sport.

title: Limit of 10 'higher force' headers a week in training in England
description: Professional footballers in England are to be limited to 10 "higher force headers" a week in training under new guidelines for the 2021-22 season.

title: Simone Biles withdraws from all-around final
description: American gymnast and four-time Olympic gold medallist Simone Biles withdraws from the individual all-around final Tokyo Olympics.

title: From garden pool to Olympic gold
description: Matt Richards' relay swim team almost broke the world record as they won gold in Tokyo.

title: GB claim relay gold in the pool & silver in rowing - what's happened so far on day five?
description: Olympic gold and silver medallists Tom Dean and Duncan Scott help Great Britain win the 4x200m freestyle relay as the team's gold run continues.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain win emphatic gold in 4x200m freestyle relay
description: Great Britain's men secure another gold in the Olympic pool with a dominant victory in the 4x200m freestyle relay in Tokyo.

title: Tokyo Olympics: GB's Karriss Artingstall guaranteed at least a bronze medal after hard-fought victory
description: GB's Karriss Artingstall is guaranteed at least a bronze medal in the women's featherweight boxing after winning a hard-fought quarter-final against Australia's Skye Nicolson.

title: Housing market cools as stamp duty break withdrawn
description: UK house prices still rose by 10.5% compared with a year ago, Nationwide building society says.

title: Boris Johnson predicts steady economic recovery post-pandemic
description: Boris Johnson still warns of "bumps on the road" ahead as the IMF predicts 7% growth for the UK economy.

title: Murray and Salisbury out of men's doubles
description: Andy Murray's bid for an Olympic gold at a third successive Games ends as he and Joe Salisbury lose in the men's doubles semi-finals in Tokyo.

title: Covid test plan a 'pointless solution' says Iceland boss
description: Supermarket boss says government scheme only fixes half the issue because it excludes store workers.

title: Joey Jordison: Slipknot founding drummer dies aged 46
description: Jordison was a member of the mask-wearing heavy metal band and also performed with the likes of Metallica.

title: 'That is unheard of!' - reaction to GB boat's near-crash
description: How did Great Britain's men's four, poised for a push for gold, go so badly wrong in the closing stages?

title: Wayne Rooney: Police drop blackmail complaint
description: Police say no offences have taken place regarding the social media photographs of Wayne Rooney.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Great Britain women's hockey team sweep aside India and Germany beat Ireland
description: Great Britain women's hockey team continue the defence of their Olympic title with a convincing 4-1 win against India in pool A, while Germany beat Ireland.

title: Tidal turbine in Orkney starts generating power
description: The device, anchored in waters off Orkney, is now connected to the grid.

title: Scottish boy plucked from obscurity stars in Indian film Mimi on Netflix
description: Three-year-old Jacob Smith of Aberdeen was plucked from obscurity on holiday and cast with Kriti Sanon in Mimi.

title: 'Luxury' race will be among most expensive on earth
description: A four-day ultramarathon covering 120 miles on the west coast of Scotland will cost £15,499 to enter.

title: Honda workers in Swindon to face 'reality check' after it closes
description: Swindon car plant prepares to stop production on July 30 after 35 years of production.

title: The Papers: UK 'reopens to world' and 'betrayed' kids in care
description: A quarantine waiver for EU and US travellers and a cover-up in social care lead the front pages.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Dean & Duncan Scott lead Team GB to 4x200m freestyle relay gold
description: Watch highlights as Tom Dean and Duncan Scott lead Team GB to a brilliant 4x200m freestyle relay gold with a dominant display alongside Matt Richards and James Guy.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Ariarne Titmus claims second gold in women's 200m freestyle
description: Ariarne Titmus wins her latest battle with five-time Olympic gold medallist Katie Ledecky and sets a Games record in the women's 200m freestyle.

title: Kris Wu: Why a superstar sparked China's sexual consent debate
description: A growing rape allegation controversy centering on Kris Wu has renewed discussion on sexual consent.

title: Watch: 'There's going to be a crash!'
description: Team GB miss out on a medal in the men's four final after some dramatic steering issues almost cause a crash at the Tokyo Olympics.

title: Electric car charging prices 'must be fair' say MPs
description: Consumers should not have to pay excessive prices to use public car charging, MPs say.

title: What happens to British ships when satellites don't work?
description: The Royal Navy and merchant fleet have no back-up if navigation systems are disrupted, experts warn.
